newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: PRESS DIGEST - S.Korean newspapers - April 15.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - S.Korean newspapers - April 15.

text.p: The following is a summary of major stories in leading South Korean newspapers, prepared by Reuters in Seoul. Reuters has not checked the stories and does not guarantee their accuracy. Telephone: (822) 727-5650. Fax: (822) 727-5666.
- Hanbo chairman Chung Po-keun at a parliamentary hearing on Monday said he met President Kim Young-sam's second son, Hyun-chul, once in 1994.
- Prosecutors said they will summon rulling New Korea Party members Ha Soon-bong and Roh Ki-tae for questioning on suspicions they had received money from Hanbo Group.
- The prosecution questioning of politicians in connection with the Hanbo loan scandal will be completed by the end of this week, a top blue house said on Monday.

- A presidential special commission on financial reform called for drastic cuts in business barriers between the nation's banks, securities firms and insurance companies to boost the competitiveness of the financial industry.
- Some 600 legislators from around the world expressed hopes for the proposed four-party talks aimed at settling peace on the Korean Peninsula.
- South Korea and Japan agreeded to create a regular channel of security dialogue to prepare for possible contingencies in North Korea, Foreign Ministry officials said on Monday.
- The Jinro Group, which has been cash stapped in recent months, will sell real estate and other assets worth 1.2 trillion won.
